ul.li1: 51 My child, be attentive to my wisdom,
ul.li2: and to my understanding incline your ear;
ul.li1: 2in order to keep prudence,
ul.li2: and knowledge will guard your lips.
ul.li1: 3For the lips of the strange woman will drip honey,
ul.li2: and smoother than oil is her mouth.Or “palate”
ul.li1: 4But her end is bitter as the wormwood,
ul.li2: sharp as a two-edged sword.
ul.li1: 5Her feet go down to death;
ul.li2: her steps take hold of Sheol.A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld
ul.li1: 6She does not observeOr “examine, weigh” the path of life;
ul.li2: her ways wander, and she does not know it.

chapter.pericope: Do Not Commit Adultery Against Wisdom

ul.li1: 7Now, O children, listen to me;
ul.li2: do not depart from the sayings of my mouth.
ul.li1: 8Keep your paths far from her,
ul.li2: and do not go near to the door of her house,
ul.li1: 9lest you give your honor to the others,
ul.li2: and your years to the merciless,
ul.li1: 10lest strangers take their fill of your strength,
ul.li2: and your labors go to the house of a foreigner,
ul.li1: 11and you groan at your end,
ul.li2: when your flesh and body are consumed,
ul.li1: 12and say “How I hated discipline,
ul.li2: and I despised reproof!”
ul.li1: 13and “I did not listen to the voice of my teachers,
ul.li2: and I did not incline my ear to my instructors!
ul.li1: 14I was almost at utterOr “all, every, whole” ruinOr “evil”
ul.li2: in the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
ul.li1: 15Drink water from your own cistern
ul.li2: and flowing waters from inside your own well.
ul.li1: 16Shall your springs be scattered outward?
ul.li2: In the streets, shall there be streams of water?
ul.li1: 17May they be yours alone,
ul.li2: and not for strangers who are with you.
ul.li1: 18May your fountain be blessed,
ul.li2: and rejoice in the wifeOr “woman” of your youth.
ul.li1: 19She is a deer of love and a doe of grace;
ul.li2: may her breasts satisfy you always;Literally “at all time”
by her love may you be intoxicated continually.
ul.li1: 20Why should you be intoxicated, my child, by a strange woman,
ul.li2: and embrace the bosom of a foreigner?
ul.li1: 21For before the eyes of Yahweh are human ways,Literally “the ways of man/humankind”
ul.li2: and all his paths he examines.
ul.li1: 22His iniquities shall ensnare him, the evildoer,
ul.li2: and in the vanity of his sin he shall be caught.
ul.li1: 23He shall die for lack ofLiterally “with there is no” discipline,
ul.li2: and in the greatness of his folly he shall be lost.
